jinngine.collision
Interface BroadfaseCollisionDetection

All Known Implementing Classes:
AllPairsTest, SweepAndPrune
public interface BroadfaseCollisionDetection

Broad-phase collision detection is the process of finding objects in a simulation, that are in close proximity of each other. Often, implementations are using axis aligned bounding boxes (AABB's), or some other simple geometric bounding volume, to simplify the problem. The main motivation of broad-phase collision detection, is to cheaply cull away object pairs, that is of no interest to any later collision detection and/or contact determination.

run

void run()
Run the broad-phase collision detection. This call will invoke calls to any registered event handler, se BroadfaseCollisionDetection.Handler. The method overlap() in the BroadfaseCollisionDetection.Handler interface, is called when ever a new overlap between two objects arises. separation() is invoked when an overlap vanishes.
